(Saved responses are view only)
Based on the provided sources, the DELFI Cognitive E&P Environment (often referred to as the DELFI environment or DELFI framework) is described as a secure, cognitive, cloud-based collaborative environment that integrates data and workflows with digital technologies, such as artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML),.
In the larger context of frameworks, the sources characterize DELFI as follows:
1. A Framework of Frameworks
The DELFI environment is explicitly defined as a "framework of frameworks",. It serves as a hosting environment or operative hub for various other specific computational frameworks and simulators used in geosciences and geoengineering,. This architecture allows for the rapid simulation of multiple concurrent cases,.
2. Integrated Computational Frameworks
The sources identify several specific frameworks that may be implemented within or operatively coupled to the DELFI environment to perform subsurface analysis, planning, construction, and production tasks,,,:
• PETREL: A software framework for geosciences and geoengineering used to analyze subsurface data from exploration to production,.
• TECHLOG: A framework for handling and processing field and laboratory data (e.g., deepwater exploration, shale) and structuring wellbore data,.
• DRILLPLAN: A framework for digital well construction planning, including automation of repetitive tasks and validation workflows,.
• DRILLOPS: A framework to execute digital drilling plans, ensure plan adherence, and deliver goal-based automation.
• ECLIPSE: A reservoir simulator framework providing numerical solvers for predicting dynamic reservoir behavior,.
• INTERSECT: A high-resolution reservoir simulator for simulating geological features, quantifying uncertainties, and modeling surface facilities and field operations,.
• PIPESIM: A simulator for multiphase flow, flowline, and surface facility performance,.
• PETROMOD: A petroleum systems modeling framework.
3. Operational Capabilities
Within the context of these frameworks, the DELFI environment facilitates specific operational workflows:
• Workspace Management: It provides a workspace framework for the instantiation, rendering, and interaction with graphical user interfaces (GUIs),.
• Data Visualization and Insight: The environment allows users to browse maps/workspaces to gain awareness of current events relevant to exploration efforts (e.g., browsing news content temporally and spatially). Note: Source refers to an E&P platform as "DELPHI," which appears to be a variation or typo referring to the same environment.
• Simulation: It supports workflows that utilize simulators (like INTERSECT) to update results continuously via real-time data exchanges.
